attributes.comment:
The challenge of any centralized directory will be ensuring it is both evergreen and accurate. Currently, the NPPES NPI is the closest thing we have to such a public dataset, but it is fraught with out-of-date records, typographical errors, and other mistakes that make the data usable, but not entirely accurate or end-user friendly.

Any new database/directory will need to have required elements that must be reviewed at least annually, to wit I also propose creating a "Review National Directory Entry" measure in QPP's Promoting Interoperability measure set that requires QPP eligible providers check their NPPES (or equivalent future directory) for accuracy and consistency annually.

Some suggested required elements: full name, primary practice name or facility name, primary practice location address, primary location phone, primary taxonomy, Direct Message address (for C-CDA sharing), and provider credentials.
Recommended, but optional elements: secondary practice name(s), secondary practice location address(es), secondary location phone, and secondary taxonomy.
Encourage all other tertiary & sequela items as well.

Leveraging an existing dataset, such as the NPEES NPI database, but ensuring it is accurate will go a long way with the population and development of this proposed directory.
